description:
11.77 drawgrid
Draw a grid on the input image.

It accepts the following parameters:


The parameters for x, y, w and h and t are expressions containing the
following constants:
name: drawgrid

options.description: The expressions which specify the coordinates of some point of grid intersection (meant to configure offset). Both default to 0.
options.name: x

options.description: The expressions which specify the coordinates of some point of grid intersection (meant to configure offset). Both default to 0.
options.name: y

options.description: The expressions which specify the width and height of the grid cell, if 0 they are interpreted as the input width and height, respectively, minus thickness, so image gets framed. Default to 0.
options.name: width

options.description: The expressions which specify the width and height of the grid cell, if 0 they are interpreted as the input width and height, respectively, minus thickness, so image gets framed. Default to 0.
options.name: height

options.description: Specify the color of the grid. For the general syntax of this option, check the (ffmpeg-utils)"Color" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. If the special value invert is used, the grid color is the same as the video with inverted luma.
options.name: color

options.description:
The expression which sets the thickness of the grid line. Default value is 1.

See below for the list of accepted constants.
options.name: thickness

options.description: Applicable if the input has alpha. With 1 the pixels of the painted grid will overwrite the video’s color and alpha pixels. Default is 0, which composites the grid onto the input, leaving the video’s alpha intact.
options.name: replace
